results.title: Navy in focus. Island sailors
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows training of native recruits for the Papua New Guinea Division, Royal Australian Navy, at Manus Island and in Australia. Training includes strategy on land, at sea, survival at sea, as well as technical instruction in engineering, navigation, radio operating and other specialised fields. Shows an intensive campaign of recruitment throughout the island, and the enthusiastic response of the Papua New Guineans.

results.title: Navy for a new nation
results.brief_description: Portrays the role of the Royal Australian Navy in Papua New Guinea, particularly in the training of Papuans and New Guineans for increased responsibility as they approach independence.

results.title: Navigation in the hills
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Dybeck, Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: Using a blend of map, diagram, model and reality, deals with the basic essentials of map reading and finding one’s way. Covers contours - type of slope and recognition of features, route planning, speed of travel in varying situations, direction - by recognition of features, and by compass, use of the silva compass, navigation in mist.

results.title: Navigating the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Two R.A.N. Patrol Boats H.M.A.S Aitape and H.M.A.S. Lavada travel 200 miles up the Sepik River in Papua New Guinea, visiting the villages of Angoram, Tambanam and Avatip. The Sepik is one of the biggest and least-known rivers in the world; a river of moving mud, floating islands and rushing currents.

results.title: Naval photography in science
results.brief_description: Illustrates the uses of photography in scientific research and development. Techniques shown include time-lapse, high-speed, slow-motion, stroboscopic, microscopic, macroscopic and under-water photography. Sequences of the moon in motion, the blood circulation of a living brain and of the earth as seen from 10 miles altitude, are included.

results.title: Navajo children
results.creator_credit: Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Set in Arizona and New Mexico, this is a charming film showing the home life of a family of Navajo Indians, and includes a record of their annual trek from winter to summer pasturelands for their herds of sheep, goats and horses.

results.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Top Craft, Tokuma Shoten and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

results.title: Naughty nostalgia. - Volume 1 (E)
results.brief_description: This video contains three of the earliest known pornographic films of the 1920s era. Each is shown complete with the original title cards, honky tonk music track, vintage automobiles and black stockings and hats of the day.

results.title: Naughty cartoons (E)
results.brief_description: A patchy collection of cult, unusual and obscure ‘erotic’ based animation. As a whole overtly designed to titillate on the most obvious level (these animations being the least affective), with only a few having any merit. Generally an over-use of ‘visual friction’ throughout. Some of the better ones: Karl Krogsta’s clay animation Jack in the Fox, Susan Pittkraning’s drawing based Crocus, Lapoujade’s L’ombre De La Pomme (with jazz soundtrack). The fifteen plus cartoons represent pornographic animation from the early 1900’s to contemporary times.
